  • Linx-Api-Key: mysecretkey - Authentication key

Optional Headers

  • Linx-Delete-Key: mysecret - Set custom delete key
  • Linx-Access-Key: mysecret - Password-protect file with an access key
  • Linx-Expiry: 1h - Set file expiry (Go duration or seconds)
  • Accept: application/json - Request JSON response

Upload a File (Random Filename)

Send a PUT request to:

{{ .SiteURL }}upload
{{- template "uploadHeaders" . -}}

Default Response

The URL of the uploaded file.

JSON Response

{{- template "payload" (set (deepCopy .) "withExtras" true) -}}

Examples

Basic upload

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload {{- $defaultFlags }} -T myphoto.jpg
{{ .SiteURL }}{{ randAlphaNum 8 }}.jpg

Upload with expiry

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload {{- $defaultFlags }} -H 'Linx-Expiry: 20m' -T myphoto.jpg
{{ .SiteURL }}{{ randAlphaNum 8 }}.jpg

Upload from pipe

$ echo hello world | curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload {{- $defaultFlags }} -T -
{{ .SiteURL }}{{ randAlphaNum 8 }}.txt
{{- if not .ForceRandom }}

Upload with hardcoded file extension

Nested extensions will not be detected correctly. To avoid this, specify the file extension explicitly. For example, example.tar.gz would be uploaded with a .gz extension. 

{{ "" -}}
$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload/.tar.gz {{- $defaultFlags }} -T example.tar.gz
{{ .SiteURL }}{{ randAlphaNum 8 }}.tar.gz
        {{- "" }}
{{- end }}
{{- if not .ForceRandom }}

Upload a File (Choose Filename)

Send a PUT request to:

{{ .SiteURL }}upload/[filename][.extension]

Both the filename and extension parameters are optional:

  • Both Provided: The file is saved exactly as given. If a file with that name already exists, a numeric suffix is appended.
  • Filename only: The server infers the extension from the fileâ€™s MIME type.
  • Extension only: A random filename is generated, with the specified extension applied.
{{- template "uploadHeaders" . -}}

Default Response

The URL of the uploaded file.

JSON Response

{{- template "payload" (set (set (set (deepCopy .) "withExtras" true) "withFile" "myphoto.jpg") "withSize" "1048576") -}}

Examples

Basic upload

Note the trailing /. This makes curl append the filename to the URL. 

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload/ {{- $defaultFlags }} -T myphoto.jpg
{{ .SiteURL }}myphoto.jpg

Upload from pipe

$ echo hello world | curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload/example.txt {{- $defaultFlags }} -T -
{{ .SiteURL }}example.txt
{{- end }}

Overwrite a File

Upload again with the same filename and include the original deletion key.

{{- template "deleteKeyRequired" . -}}

Examples

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}upload/ {{- $defaultFlags }} -H 'Linx-Delete-Key: mysecret' -T myphoto.jpg
{{ .SiteURL }}myphoto.jpg

Delete a File

Send a DELETE request to the public file URL and include the original deletion key.

{{- template "deleteKeyRequired" . -}}

Examples

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}myphoto.jpg -X DELETE {{- $defaultFlags }} -H 'Linx-Delete-Key: mysecret'
DELETED

Retrieve File Info

Send a GET request to the public file URL and request a JSON response.

Required Headers

  • Accept: application/json

JSON Response

{{- template "payload" (set (set (deepCopy .) "withFile" "myphoto.jpg") "withSize" "1048576") -}}

Examples

$ curl {{ .SiteURL }}myphoto.jpg -H 'Accept: application/json'

Client
